titleStmt.title: F. E. Powell et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9784

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his Excellency B Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Hickman Graves and Ballard Counties respectfully represent that at the last term of the Hickman Equity & Criminal Court J W Long was tried and convicted of the crime of murder. Your petitioners further state that they have heard many facts that induce them to believe that there is a great probability that the Crime Committed by said Long was Manslaughter instead of murder as found by the verdict of the Jury, and we believe that his Case presents Strong grounds for the interposition of Executive clemency. Wherefore we respectfully ask your Excellency to Commute the punishment of said Long to imprisonment for life or a term of Years.

F E Powell
A. B Whayne
J A Rieger
E House
B S Loafman
G Ellegood
John C. Williams
W. M. Anderson
H. S Pickett
F G Pickett
P J Gevelton
H, W Saltman
Geo, S. Hobbs
B. F. Jackson

D C Vid
A J Rycels
R, T, Milburne
A. A. Powell
Jacob Edwards
F. Simmons
R. G. Kirkpatrick
Henderson Stacy
J. C. Williams
W L Jewell
Lewis Jewell
Without Knowing the facts I place my name to this
petition believing the ends of Justice as well answered by imprisonment -- A J ward
T C Whayne
C P Wooden
